text: The Royal Palace of Aranjuez () is one of the places the King of Spain lives. It is in the town of Aranjuez, Community of Madrid, Spain. The palace is open to the public as one of the Spanish royal sites. It was originally the site of a medieval hunting lodge.Josephine Quintero; Mary-Ann Gallagher, DK Eyewitness Travel Guide: Spain (London: DK Pub., 2011), p. 333 Philip II built it as a modest summer palace.Anthony Ham, Lonely Planet Madrid (Footscray, Vic.; London: Lonely Planet, 2010), p. 246 The palace was designed by Juan Bautista de Toledo and Juan de Herrera who also designed El Escorial. Later kings kept adding to it. It was completed during the reign of Ferdinand VI in the mid-18th century. Charles III added two wings to it. By that time the palace had over 300 rooms. The Royal Palace of Aranjuez was one of 100 finalists for the 12 Treasures of Spain in 2007. ==Gallery== File:Aranjuez_Palacio_Real_1.jpg|Royal Palace of Aranjuez.
